intro: Traganum moquinii, commonly known as the African Speargrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tall, spiny stalks and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Traganum moquinii is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
